events.originalText: Yak-Service Flight 9633, carrying the players and coaching staff of the ice hockey team Lokomotiv Yaroslavl, crashed on take-off near Yaroslavl, Russia, resulting in the deaths of 44 of the 45 people on board.
events.subtitle: Lokomotiv Yaroslavl plane crash
events.headline: Yak-Service Flight 9633 crashes near Yaroslavl, Russia, killing 44 of 45 on board

events.originalText: A Chinese fishing trawler operating in disputed waters collided with Japan Coast Guard patrol boats near the Senkaku Islands, sparking a major diplomatic dispute between the two countries.
events.subtitle: Fishing trawler
events.headline: Chinese fishing trawler collision near Senkaku Islands sparks diplomatic dispute

events.originalText: A Chinese fishing trawler operating in disputed waters collided with Japan Coast Guard patrol boats near the Senkaku Islands, sparking a major diplomatic dispute between the two countries.
events.subtitle: Fishing trawler
events.headline: Hurricane Ivan devastates Grenada, destroying 85% of buildings

events.originalText: Hurricane Ivan made landfall on Grenada and devastated at least 85 percent of buildings on the island.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Ivan
events.headline: Second earthquake strikes Athens after northwestern Turkey quake

events.originalText: Three weeks after an earthquake struck northwestern Turkey, a second earthquake struck Athens, causing Greece and Turkey to initiate "earthquake diplomacy".
events.subtitle: 1999 İzmit earthquake
events.headline: Desmond Tutu becomes first black leader of Anglican Church of Southern Africa

events.originalText: Desmond Tutu (pictured) became the first black leader of the Anglican Church of Southern Africa.
events.subtitle: Desmond Tutu
events.headline: Explosion on Maltese patrol boat off Gozo kills seven

events.originalText: An explosion on board a Maltese patrol boat that was disposing of illegal fireworks at sea off Gozo killed seven soldiers and policemen.
events.subtitle: C23 tragedy
events.headline: Luftwaffe begins bombing London in Battle of Britain strategy change

events.originalText: Second World War: The Luftwaffe changed their strategy in the Battle of Britain and began bombing London and other cities and towns
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Last thylacine dies in captivity at Hobart Zoo, Australia

events.originalText: Second World War: The Luftwaffe changed their strategy in the Battle of Britain and began bombing London and other cities and towns.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Supreme War Command established in World War I for Central Powers

events.originalText: The last thylacine died in captivity in Hobart Zoo, Australia.
events.subtitle: Thylacine
events.headline: French Grande Armée and Imperial Russian Army clash at Borodino during Napoleonic Wars

events.originalText: The last thylacine (pictured) died in captivity in Hobart Zoo, Australia.
events.subtitle: Thylacine
events.headline: France captures Dominica fort in Anglo-French War

events.originalText: World War I: The 'Supreme War Command was established to oversee the armed forces of all the Central Powers.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Chinese rebellion against Dutch rule on Formosa suppressed

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: The French Grande Armée and the Imperial Russian Army fought near the village of Borodino during the French invasion of Russia.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: Richard I of England defeats Saladin at Battle of Arsuf during Third Crusade

events.originalText: Anglo-French War: France invaded the Caribbean island of Dominica and captured its British fort before Britain had even learned of the Franco-American alliance.
events.subtitle: Anglo-French War (1778–1783)

events.originalText: Anglo-French War: France invaded the Caribbean island of Dominica and captured its British fort before Britain had even learned of the Franco-American alliance.
events.subtitle: Anglo-French War (1778–1783)

events.originalText: Chinese peasants on Formosa (now Taiwan) began a rebellion against Dutch rule which was suppressed four days later.
events.subtitle: Geography of Taiwan

events.originalText: Chinese peasants on Formosa (now Taiwan) began a rebellion against Dutch rule which was suppressed four days later.
events.subtitle: Geography of Taiwan

events.originalText: Third Crusade: Crusaders under Richard I of England defeated Ayyubid troops under Saladin at the Battle of Arsuf in present-day Israel.
events.subtitle: Third Crusade
